coverage: Comprehensive Obadiah: prophet and vision frame; Edom/Esau pride, place, and downfall; allies, wisdom, and military undone; eightfold ‘do not’ charges; victims (Jacob/House of Jacob/Joseph) and Zion; nations gathered for the Day; restoration and repossession map (Negev, Shephelah, Ephraim, Samaria, Benjamin, Gilead), diaspora (Zarephath, Sepharad); deliverers and kingdom; geographies; intertexts with Jeremiah 49 and Genesis; Jewish/Christian reception; theological and rhetorical themes.
id_scheme: Cross-book stable by (type+primary-slug) with alias support; deterministic for new entries; reuses shared entities where present.

entries.name: Obadiah (prophet)
entries.blurb: Name means ‘Servant of YHWH.’ Apart from the superscription, the prophet remains anonymous—his authority rests on the vision, not on pedigree.

entries.name: Vision frame: ‘The vision of Obadiah’
entries.blurb: Prophetic genre marker; the word comes as sight—insight into the moral architecture of history.

entries.name: Heavenly report and messenger to the nations
entries.blurb: Divine council imagery: a report is heard, a messenger goes out—God stirs an international response to Edom.

entries.name: Edom (nation of Esau)
entries.blurb: Brother nation defined by proud security and fraternal betrayal. Obadiah addresses the national character, not only its elites.

entries.name: Esau (ancestor, typological)
entries.blurb: The eponym ‘Esau’ evokes the Genesis conflict of brothers (Jacob/Esau) as a pattern of kinship gone wrong.

entries.name: Mount Esau / Seir (high places)
entries.blurb: Edom’s mountainous stronghold—geography misread as invincibility; God will bring down the proud.

entries.name: Pride deceives you (rock‑dwellers)
entries.blurb: Edom trusts in altitude, alliances, and cunning. Pride is a theological hallucination that misreads reality.

entries.name: Eagle’s nest boast
entries.blurb: Even if you set your nest among the stars, from there I will bring you down—anti‑Babel warning recast for Edom.

entries.name: Confederates/allies who deceive Edom
entries.blurb: Those who ate your bread set a trap—diplomacy boomerangs; realpolitik cannot save against divine justice.

entries.name: Those at peace with you / trusted friends
entries.blurb: Inner‑circle partners lead Edom to the border; betrayal from within undermines fortress pride.

entries.name: Wise men of Teman (to be cut off)
entries.blurb: Edom’s famed sages—decision‑makers whose counsel dries up under judgment.

entries.name: Mighty men of Teman (dismayed)
entries.blurb: Warriors lose heart; courage evaporates when God sets the day.

entries.name: Do not gloat over your brother’s day
entries.blurb: Schadenfreude against kin magnifies guilt; covenant ethics protect the vulnerable—even when judged.

entries.name: Do not rejoice over Judah’s people in the day of their ruin
entries.blurb: Joy at disaster profanes solidarity; rejoicing turns to reaping.

entries.name: Do not boast in the day of distress
entries.blurb: Public boasting weaponizes humiliation; pride recruits a crowd.

entries.name: Do not enter the gate of my people
entries.blurb: Looting sacred space violates sanctuary and neighbor; the city’s gate becomes a crime scene.

entries.name: Do not look with glee on his misfortune
entries.blurb: Voyeurism of suffering is complicity; gaze becomes participation.

entries.name: Do not loot his wealth in the day of calamity
entries.blurb: Economic predation completes the moral collapse—plunder as opportunism.

entries.name: Do not stand at the crossroads to cut off fugitives
entries.blurb: Ambush of refugees turns retreat into slaughter; geography weaponized.

entries.name: Do not hand over survivors
entries.blurb: Extradition of escapees collaborates with the oppressor, compounding bloodguilt.

entries.name: Jacob/your brother (kinship ethic)
entries.blurb: The charge is fratricide: violence against Jacob violates the brotherhood that God Himself authored.

entries.name: House of Jacob
entries.blurb: Corporate Israel pictured as a household to be restored to holiness and repossession.

entries.name: House of Joseph (northern tribes)
entries.blurb: Northern remnant folded into restoration—unity beyond the split monarchy.

entries.name: Jerusalem/Zion (refuge and holiness)
entries.blurb: Mount Zion becomes a sanctuary and a base for repossession; holiness is the engine of recovery.

entries.name: All nations under judgment
entries.blurb: Edom becomes a case study for a universal principle—the Day of YHWH is near upon all nations.

entries.name: As you have done, it shall be done to you
entries.blurb: Lex talionis scaled to history; moral causality threads through geopolitics.

entries.name: Drinking the cup on the holy mountain
entries.blurb: Those who drank on Zion (in triumph) will drink judgment to the dregs; revelry flips to ruin.

entries.name: They shall be as though they had not been
entries.blurb: Obliteration formula—God’s judgment can unmake prideful polities.

entries.name: Deliverance on Mount Zion
entries.blurb: Holiness and rescue intertwine—salvation is not escape from holiness but its fruit.

entries.name: House of Jacob shall possess their possessions
entries.blurb: Reversal of dispossession; covenant inheritance restored by divine verdict.

entries.name: House of Jacob a fire; House of Joseph a flame
entries.blurb: Dual image of reunified Israel as purifying fire against Esau’s stubble.

entries.name: House of Esau stubble
entries.blurb: Combustible pride meets covenant flame; no survivor from Esau—hyperbolic finality of judgment oracle.

entries.name: Possessors from the Negev (mountain of Esau)
entries.blurb: Southern communities reclaim Edomite highlands—geopolitical reversal.

entries.name: Possessors of the Shephelah (Philistines)
entries.blurb: Foothill dwellers extend claim into Philistine territory—restoration widens the borders.

entries.name: Possessors of the hill country of Ephraim and Samaria
entries.blurb: Northern heartlands re‑incorporated—diaspora wounds healed.

entries.name: Benjamin shall possess Gilead
entries.blurb: Eastern territories assigned to Benjamin—a symbolic stitching of the land across the Jordan.

entries.name: Exiles of Israel (Canaan to Zarephath)
entries.blurb: Western/northern diaspora returns—from Phoenician Zarephath to the land of Canaan.

entries.name: Exiles of Jerusalem in Sepharad
entries.blurb: Far‑flung deportees (location debated: Spain? Sardis?) are included in the great return.
entries.note: ‘Sepharad’ likely Asia Minor (Sardis) in many scholarly proposals; later Jewish tradition reads ‘Spain’.

entries.name: Deliverers (saviors) ascend Mount Zion
entries.blurb: A collegium of leaders executes judgment on Mount Esau—shared rule under God.

entries.name: The kingdom shall be the LORD’s
entries.blurb: Climactic claim: sovereignty belongs to YHWH; political theology consummated.

entries.name: Teman
entries.blurb: Edomite district famed for wisdom and warriors; emblem of strength now undone.

entries.name: Seir
entries.blurb: Mountainous region synonymous with Edom—crags mistaken for castles.

entries.name: Negev (South)
entries.blurb: Arid southlands whose communities become frontier possessors.

entries.name: Shephelah (foothills)
entries.blurb: Transition zone between hill country and coast—launchpad for reclaiming Philistia.

entries.name: Ephraim
entries.blurb: Northern hill country; shorthand for Israel; restored to possession.

entries.name: Samaria
entries.blurb: Former northern capital; its inclusion signals reunification with Judah.

entries.name: Benjamin
entries.blurb: Southern tribe bordering Jerusalem; receives Gilead in the oracle’s map.

entries.name: Gilead
entries.blurb: Transjordanian region east of Jordan—symbol of a fully mended land.

entries.name: Zarephath
entries.blurb: Phoenician coastal town (between Tyre and Sidon); markers of far‑western diaspora.

entries.name: Sepharad
entries.blurb: Exilic toponym—site of Judean diaspora; exact ID debated.

entries.name: Mount Zion
entries.blurb: Holy hill of deliverance and governance; counter‑mountain to Mount Esau.

entries.name: Mount Esau
entries.blurb: Stage of judgment for the deliverers; last bastion of Edomite pride.

entries.name: Parallel oracle in Jeremiah 49:7–22
entries.blurb: Shared themes and phrases suggest a literary relationship or common tradition against Edom.

entries.name: Genesis backdrop: Jacob & Esau
entries.blurb: Sibling rivalry matures into national ethics; prophecy re‑reads family history as geopolitics.

entries.name: Later Jewish reading: Edom as Rome
entries.blurb: Edom becomes cipher for imperial oppression; Obadiah fuels resistance and hope.

entries.name: Christian reception: Kingdom is the LORD’s
entries.blurb: Themes of the Day of the Lord and the universal kingdom inform NT eschatology.

entries.name: Pride before the fall (theology of humility)
entries.blurb: Obadiah crystallizes the axiom that pride blinds and isolates; humility is realism before God.

entries.name: Kinship ethics (brotherhood obligation)
entries.blurb: To harm a brother is to attack God’s covenant design; fratricide is sacrilege.

entries.name: Holiness & territory (holy hill, holy people)
entries.blurb: Holiness is not retreat but renewal; land and people are re‑ordered by sanctity.

entries.name: Reap what you sow (measure returned)
entries.blurb: Moral boomerang—actions return enlarged; just recompense governs nations.

entries.name: No survivor for Esau (oracle hyperbole)
entries.blurb: Prophetic totalizing language to underline finality of judgment on systemic evil.
